import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd
import warnings
warnings.simplefilter("ignore")
from scipy.special import boxcox
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
%matplotlib inline
import plotly
import plotly.plotly as py
import plotly.offline as offline
import plotly.graph_objs as go
from plotly.offline import download_plotlyjs, init_notebook_mode, plot, iplot
init_notebook_mode(connected=True)
import cufflinks as cf
from plotly.graph_objs import Scatter, Figure, Layout
cf.set_config_file(offline=True)
# begin secret_token
from shutil import copyfile
copyfile(src = "../input/private-mapbox-access-token/private_mapbox_access_token.py", dst = "../working/private_mapbox_access_token.py")
from private_mapbox_access_token import *
private_mapbox_access_token = private_mapbox_access_token()
# end secret_token
train = pd.read_csv('../input//ghana-health-facilities/health-facilities-gh.csv')
print("Total Number of Health Clinics in Ghana: {}".format(train.shape[0]))
source.d40f2728:
target = train['Region']
data = [go.Histogram(x=target)]
layout = go.Layout(title = "Health Clinics Per Region")
fig = go.Figure(data=data, layout=layout)
iplot(fig)
source.1347d824:
# Adapted from https://www.kaggle.com/shaz13/simple-exploration-notebook-map-plots-v2/
data = [go.Scattermapbox(
            lat= train['Latitude'] ,
            lon= train['Longitude'],
            mode='markers',
            text=train['FacilityName'],
            marker=dict(
                size= 10,
                color = 'black',
                opacity = .8,
            ),
          )]
layout = go.Layout(autosize=False,
                   mapbox= dict(accesstoken=private_mapbox_access_token,
                                bearing=0,
                                pitch=0,
                                zoom=7,
                                center= dict(
                                         lat=8.38,
                                         lon=0.5),
                               ),
                    width=1800,
                    height=1200, title = "Health Clinics in Ghana")
fig = dict(data=data, layout=layout)
iplot(fig)
